page.title: 07HOUSING IN THURLASTON
page.content: Our area is fairly prosperous with a mixture of the old and new.The new houses,mainly privately owned,range from six to seven hundred years old.Many are quite large,with garages and gardens and are made of brick.Most are well established and looked after.Many have names instead of numbers.In Thurlaston,Cawston and Toft older buildings have often been reconverted from practical village use to residential dwellings.Malt House is one which also has a cob wall.Farm buildings are scattered through the area,a few are desolate but most have out houses and some farming activity.People seem to settle in the area rather than moving on.
